item.title: ‘I don’t know why I need to go to college’: Ford CEO says his Gen Z son worked as a mechanic and wondered if the 4-year degree was still worth it - Fortune
item.description:
1. ‘I don’t know why I need to go to college’: Ford CEO says his Gen Z son worked as a mechanic and wondered if the 4-year degree was still worth it  Fortune
  2. Ford CEO on his ‘epiphany’ after talking to his Gen Z factory workers: They were saying they ‘had to have three jobs’  Yahoo Finance
  3. Why the CEO of Ford wanted his 17-year-old son to get a blue-collar summer job  Business Insider
  4. Debate between vocational school or college is real. Ask Jim Farley, who asked Mike Rowe  Detroit Free Press
  5. Ford CEO warns there’s not enough blue-collar workers to build AI data centers: ‘Nothing to backfill the ambition’  New York Post
